snippet: Abdullah al-Thinni, the second to step down from the post in two months, said he would stay on as leader of the cabinet until a replacement could be found.
abstract: Libya's interim Prime Min Abdullah al-Thinni says he will resign, becoming the second leader to step down from post in two months.
lead_paragraph: Abdullah al-Thinni, the second to step down from the post in two months, said he would stay on as leader of the cabinet until a replacement could be found.

headline.main: Prime Minister of Libya Says He Will Resign
headline.print_headline: Prime Minister of Libya Says He Will Resign
